intro: Caucaea azuayensis, commonly known as the Azuay caucaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
